column1: Herborn is served today by two railway stations and four more have been abandoned.

Herborn station was  opened in 1862 on the Dill Railway. The current station building dates from 1908 and was designed by the church architect Ludwig Hoffmann. In the past the station was served by two other lines:
services on the Aar-Salzböde railway from Niederwalgern started and ended here from 1902 to 2001
services on the Westerwaldquer Railway to Montabaur started and ended here from 1906 to 1980.The station is served by Regional-Express trains on the Siegen–Gießen–Frankfurt route (Main-Sieg-Express
column2: RE 40) and Stadt-Express services on the Dillenburg-Frankfurt route (Mittelhessen-Express
column4: running as stopping trains between Dillenburg and Gießen).
